sentences: Guillaume Veau was a thirteenth-century French trouvère.
Three chansons courtoises are attributed to him in the Vatican manuscript Reg.lat.1490:
Meudre achoison n'euc onques de chanter
S'amours loiaus m'a fait soufrirThe first two of these are unica, that is, they appear in no other source.
They both end on a note other than the tonal centre of the first four phrases.
The "moderately florid" melodies of all three are written in bar form.
